instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: No backlight when battery connected
threads.message:
Hi,
I have a MacBook Air 13" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
There was corrossion under the backlight driver <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> and no backlight. I changed the chip with a new one and now I get backlight but only if the battery is disconnected.
If I attached the battery I don't get backlight but I do get image.

Thanks in advance

threads.title: No backlight when battery connected
threads.message:
Do PRAM reset first.

Post <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> voltages, when no backlight present.
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal, at same time.
Test what happens, if LIO flex is disconnected.

threads.title: No backlight when battery connected
threads.message:
Hi, can't find <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>, did you mean <DIODE>D9701</DIODE> ?
Thanks

threads.title: No backlight when battery connected
threads.message:
OK I'll assume it's <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>
When backlight not working :-
<DIODE>D9701</DIODE> Pin 1 (<SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW</SIGNAL> fluctuates between 7.27v and 7.52v
             Pin 2 (<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> fluctuates between 7.40v to 7.52v
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 0v

** Now the backlight works on battery but as soon as I take the brightness up using the keyboard to maximum then the backlight dies again. If I close the lid and reopen the lid backlight comes back to life again.

Removing the LIO Flex makes no difference to the backlight

threads.title: No backlight when battery connected
threads.message:
Yes, <DIODE>D9701</DIODE>; I was looking at 00165 schematic, by error.

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> must be high.
Check it disconnecting trackpad flex.
If still low, check <RESISTOR>R5071</RESISTOR> value and traces.

threads.title: No backlight when battery connected
threads.message: My mistake I measuring at the wrong place. Yes <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is high and steady at 3.40v both when backlight works and when it doesnt. Is it possible the replacement backlight driver was bad or got damaged whilst I was heating it? Also it's ok to buy these chips off eBay right, I mean they are not programmed diffrently than ones off donor boards?

threads.title: No backlight when battery connected
threads.message:
New chip is OK to buy.
I suppose you didn't get good solders.
Reflow it and try to solder <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> properly.

threads.title: No backlight when battery connected
threads.message: Already reflow but it didnt help so I will replace it and let you know what happens. Thanks

threads.title: No backlight when battery connected
threads.message: You won't believe this but the chip I used for <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> was wrong. Replaced with the correct chip and all is good now. Thanks again for your help - appreciated.
